topic.title: cf-mgmt Tool Example: Add a Service to an Existing Cluster

body.p: This example demonstrates how to add a service to a cluster that already exists.

ul.li: The host for the examples needs to be able to reach your HPE Helion OpenStack environment.
Download the version of the cluster management (cf-mgmt) tool appropriate for your operating system.

ol.li: Download the latest bootstrap.yml file and save it in a location where the cf-mgmt tool can access it.

Open and configure the bootstrap_dea.yml file to match your environment. Ensure the values for image names, image sizes and availability zones ("az") are valid for your current configuration. Here is an example: constructor-image-name: HPE Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Installer 1.2.0.282 constructor-flavor: standard.xsmall seed-node-image-name: HPE Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Seed Node 1.2.0.282 core-flavor: standard.medium cluster-title: <My Cluster Title> cluster-prefix: <My Cluster Prefix> services-on-core: false flavor: standard.medium To add an existing Trove database, also include a value for the --database-instance-id parameter.

Run the following command, inserting the correct values as appropriate.
This example will work for the Windows operating system.cf-mgmt.exe ^ --os-auth-url <auth-url> ^ --os-username <username> ^ --os-password <password> ^ --os-tenant-id <id> ^ --os-tenant-name "<tenant-name>" ^ --os-region-name "<region-name>" ^ add-service mysql ^ --keypair-name <keypair name> ^ --load bootstrap_service.yml
This example will work on Mac OSX or Linux: source <path to openstackrc file> cf-mgmt.exe \ add-service mysql \ --keypair-name <keypair name> \ --load bootstrap_service.yml
